name: mischievousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of behaving badly, but not in a way that is intended to cause serious harm or damage: He has a childish, boyish, impish mischievousness. He is having difficulty controlling his natural mischievousness. See
mischievous
More examplesFewer examplesThey have little in common apart from a certain mischievousness.He had the right mix of likeability and mischievousness to make him a believable character. At the funeral, speakers recalled her mischievousness and warmth.
